aac6faa59982955179bb909138afd162 (15:01): why do PCs often include several USB1 controllers along with a USB2 controller?
aac6faa59982955179bb909138afd162 (15:01): (e.g.: my laptop has 4 USB1 controllers and 1 USB2)
c55963a3bec158d36e87abc2f9085a9e (15:03): gotta be cost :)
62115b1ea90366cbcce7a495fa28cbce (15:03): bandwidth issues? 5x480Mbit is a bit more than 4x12+480
aac6faa59982955179bb909138afd162 (15:04): but why does it have a USB1 controller at all, let alone 4?  isn't it backwards compatible?
62115b1ea90366cbcce7a495fa28cbce (15:05): for mice/keyboards etc, you don't need USB2.. but you might need more power than one bus can provide
62115b1ea90366cbcce7a495fa28cbce (15:07): I'm just guessing though :)
7745adb1bd8df8704f3f993df58bc843 (15:08): USB is used for many internal devices, not only for ports.
aac6faa59982955179bb909138afd162 (15:10): hm, i suppose that makes sense, but i only seem to have 1 internal device
